Text.Value: Insolent, even now. I heard you were like that.
And lo, you have appeared. It is time for you to return to the fold.
She did. And I feel her patience is running thin. I hope you have good news for her. First, you need to continue onwards into the Lower City.
I'll be remaining here - I have business to attend to, wares to sell. Our great endeavour cannot run on faith alone - we need funds. Have a look, if you wish.
I'm not here to answer to you, or anyone else. I'm here for my parents.

EditorData.NodeContext: Overall Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and is on a mission to Baldur's Gate to save her captive parents.

Text.Value: Rennald... Now there is a name I haven't heard in a while. He is no more. I'll leave the rest for you to find out, heretic.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unpleasant smile, relishing in twisting the knife. (In reality 'Rennald' is now Nightshade, a transgender friend of Shadowheart's who she can't remember).

Text.Value: The Mother Superior sent you?
Hmm. Some thought you might have been humbled by your mission - learned a little deference. Clearly not. First, you must continue into the Lower City.

Then seek out a place called the House of Grief. It may not be quite what you expect, but I assure you it's the right spot. Go there, and make yourself known. You will be given the welcome you deserve.
The Mother Superior sent you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Overall arc: Shadowheart has been blessed by her goddess Shar after sacrificing Nightsong. She is now on a mission to seize control of Shar's church and followers in Baldur's Gate

Text.Value: I'll make my way there.
If that was supposed to be a pick-up line, I think it needs more work.
You're talking about the cloister? Point the way.
There is no mistake, Shadowheart. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.
*A follower of Shar. An agent of the Mother Superior. Sent to keep watch for you.*
What can I expect once I'm admitted?
Leave.
I don't envy you, I'll admit... There's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.
No. Perhaps you've mistaken me for somebody else?
Bold of you - brave, even. Though do not assume passing admiration will translate to mercy when you kneel before the Mother Superior.
Though if I was you, I'd be very tempted to just forget it all and disappear. You have some form at doing so, after all.
Tell me one thing... Is there someone called Rennald there? A tiefling with short horns and purple hair.
Oh no, I must remain here. In truth, I'm glad to keep my distance for now... There's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.
Shar forsakes everyone in the end. Her embrace is a lie.
Many of us were convinced you'd never actually show your face in this city again. But here you are, and the gold in my purse is soon to take flight.
Besides, I have business to attend to, wares to sell. Our great endeavour cannot run on faith alone - we need funds. Have a look, if you wish.
Someone who bet that you'd never be foolish enough to actually show your face in this city again. But here you are, and the gold in my purse is soon to take flight.
I have... strayed, it is true. But I have come to make amends, and face judgement.
And spoil the surprise? I dare not. Though I will admit there's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.
Maybe so. Where is it you think I'm expected?
I'm not here to submit. I'm here to cleanse Lady Shar's ranks. She decreed it.
Do I know you?
You're welcome?
Why, home, of course. The only one you have ever known. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.
I can't help but feel the strangest twinge of disgust as I look upon you. Is it true? Has our Lady forsaken you?
Who are you?
Otherwise, I think we're done. Try not to dawdle too much in the city - Mother's waiting.
Rennald... Now there's a name I haven't heard in some time. But not for me to spoil what Lady Shar would keep hidden from you. Best if you looked for yourself.
I just lost a wager, thanks to you.
Who are you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Overall Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and is on a mission to Baldur's Gate to save her captive parents.

Text.Value: Tell me... is there someone called Rennald there? A tiefling with short horns and purple hair.
No true child of Lady Shar would be that poor a liar. The rot of heresy truly has taken hold in you.
Can't you show me yourself?
So, the rot of heresy has gripped you. So be it.
I'm not here to answer to you, or anyone else. I'm here for my parents.
Don't flatter yourself - you're not my type. Even though we have more in common than you remember.
Now I must report your reappearance. If you are intent on bringing matters to a head, then seek out the House of Grief, in the Lower City.
Do I know you?

EditorData.NodeContext: Overall arc: Shadowheart has been blessed by her goddess Shar after sacrificing Nightsong. She is now on a mission to seize control of Shar's church and followers in Baldur's Gate

Text.Value: What a sight for sore eyes. I believe there's somewhere you're supposed to be, no? Long overdue, in fact.
No, but I know you. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.
So close to home and yet you need a guiding hand. Amazing how malleable - or fragile - the mind can be. First, you need to continue onwards into the Lower City.

Synopsis: Ferg, a Sharran Informer is Shadowheart's contact for her to reach out to when completing her mission. He impresses they have been waiting for her return. If on the Shar Path he will reveal that there is a chance for Shadowheart to take over. If not, he will be deeply skeptical of Shadowheart.
